required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CureDuchenne Link™: A Resource for Research
clinical_study.official_title: CureDuchenne Link™: A Resource to Support Research Studies in Duchenne and Becker Muscular Dystrophy (DMD/BMD)

brief_summary.textblock: CureDuchenne link is a data hub comprised of integrated biospecimens, clinical data, and self- and/or caregiver-reported information from participants. Anyone over 4 weeks old who has been diagnosed with DMD or BMD or who is a carrier of DMD or BMD can join. Parents or legal guardians can sign up their child(ren).

detailed_description.textblock:
Individuals can participate through the CureDuchenne Link™ application (accessible via mobile device or web interface) and receive communications about research opportunities and community programs. Participation may be done using virtual methods, at a project site, and/or at community events nationwide.
All collected information will be stored in a secure, HIPAA-compliant data warehouse for approved researchers to use for studies relevant to DMD, BMD and other neuromuscular disorders. Combining health and outcomes data with biospecimens provides an impactful solution and novel resource for researchers, allowing for effective translational research.

primary_outcome.description: There is no intervention in this project. Participants will provide documentation to support their diagnosis of Duchenne muscular dystrophy, Becker muscular dystrophy, or a carrier of these mutations

primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon study entry or when genetic testing results are available
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to provide genetic testing reports confirming their diagnosis, where available, which will be reviewed by a central genetic counselor.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon study entry and every 6-12 months thereafter for up to ten (10) years
secondary_outcome.description: Self reported data (questionnaire on ambulation and mobility) will be captured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon study entry and every 6-12 months thereafter for up to ten (10) years
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically reported NSAA scores will be captured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon study entry and every 6-12 months thereafter for up to ten (10) years
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically reported 6MWT scores will be captured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon study entry and every 6-12 months thereafter for up to ten (10) years
secondary_outcome.description: Self reported and clinically reported corticosteroid status (past and present) will be captured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon study entry and every 6-12 months thereafter for up to ten (10) years
secondary_outcome.description: Self reported and clinically reported cardiac status (past and present) will be captured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon study entry and every 6-12 months thereafter for up to ten (10) years
secondary_outcome.description: Self reported and clinically reported respiratory status (past and present) will be captured

arm_group.description: Individuals with Duchenne muscular dystrophy and Becker muscular dystrophy
Carriers of Duchenne muscular dystrophy and Becker muscular dystrophy

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood, Urine, Saliva, Muscle and Skin will be collected. Sample collection will be optional.

study_pop.textblock: Individuals with or carriers of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) and Becker muscular dystrophy (BMD).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Any of the following are true:
1. Currently has a confirmed diagnosis of DMD/BMD based on genetic testing, muscle biopsy, or clinical diagnosis.
2. Currently has a confirmed diagnosis of carrier status for DMD/BMD based on genetic testing.
2. Parent/guardian (for minor participants) or participant gives informed consent and/or assent as required by local regulations.
3. Is age 4 weeks or older at the time of consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Is a foster child or ward of the state.
2. Is a prisoner.

patient_data.ipd_description: After a thorough application process, data will be shared to qualified researchers. Approved researchers will complete all required CDA/data transfer agreements with CureDuchenne. Once complete, they will be given access to a limited dataset with direct identifiers removed.
